alert.note: Alert for Sampson; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 5:18AM EDT until August 31 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Cumberland, Johnston, Sampson and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 615 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 518 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville, Clinton, Fort Liberty, Godwin, Pope AFB, Hope Mills, Spring Lake, Eastover, Roseboro, Stedman, Newton Grove, Wade, Salemburg, Falcon, Autryville, Vander, Spivey`s Corner, Cedar Creek, Bushy Lake Natural Area and Hobbton. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
